intro: Rosenbergiodendron formosum, commonly known as the Taiwan rosewood, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its ornamental leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant is known for its dense, dark wood, which is highly valued in traditional craftsmanship. It typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered an endangered species.
